an10.32:0.3: 32. Suspending the Recitation of the Monastic Code
an10.32:1.1: “Sir, how many grounds are there to suspend the recitation of the monastic code?”
an10.32:1.2: “Upāli, there are ten grounds to suspend the recitation of the monastic code.
an10.32:1.4: A mendicant who has committed an expulsion offense is sitting in the assembly. A discussion about whether someone has committed an expulsion offense is unfinished. A person who is not fully ordained is sitting in the assembly. A discussion about whether someone is fully ordained or not is unfinished. Someone who has resigned the training is sitting in the assembly. A discussion about whether someone has rejected the training or not is unfinished. A eunuch is sitting in the assembly. A discussion about whether someone is a eunuch is unfinished. A raper of nuns is sitting in the assembly. A discussion about whether or not someone is a raper of nuns is unfinished.
an10.32:1.5: These are the ten grounds to suspend the recitation of the monastic code.”
